fields.headline: Today at Wimbledon
fields.bodyText: THE DAY'S PLAY SO FAR Richard Krajicek, the only former champion still in the tournament, today ended the hopes of Paradorn Srichaphan, the Thai player who saw off Andre Agassi. The 1996 winner, who missed Wimbledon last year with a nasty elbow injury, came through 7-6 (7-5), 6-4, 6-2. He will meet the powerful Australian Mark Philippoussis in the next round. Philippoussis outgunned Germany's Nicolas Kiefer with some characteristically massive services. The Aussie, known as "The Scud" for his heavy hitting, is returning to form after a troublesome knee problem that had him confined to a wheelchair. The unseeded former quarter-finalist got into his stride in the second set and rode home with a solid 3-6, 6-3, 6-4, 6-2 victory. Second seed Serena Williams beat off a heroic fight from Belgium qualifier Els Callens but the score was a lot closer than the American would have been comfortable with. Callens, 31, pushed hard but was finally defeated 7-6 (7-5), 7-6 (7-2). Williams now faces fellow American Chanda Ruben in the next round. * * * * * * * * * * * * * WHAT THE TABLOIDS ARE SAYING IP, HIP, HOORAY. Whizkid Elena is cheered to victory by Town supremo The Sun TIM'S IN A HIT 'N' MISSUS MOOD. Lucy's heart flutters as hubby flaps The Star VENUS ON ANOTHER PLANET Daily Mirror * * * * * * * * * * * * * SPEED, AGILITY AND GREAT SERVICE MAKE IBM THE PERFECT TENNIS PARTNER IBM helps Wimbledon deliver the whole Grand Slam experience. Across multiple channels, they provide the Web site, live video feeds, interviews, player reports, up-to-the-second statistics and even the ticketing. With an IBM e-business on demand solution, Wimbledon can scale their technology up to handle the huge demands during tournament, and scale it down again when the tournament is over. As the world watches, The Championships demonstrate the winning partnership that ensures all the drama of Wimbledon stays on court. For the full story on how IBM helps Wimbledon win, and for some great offers and downloads, visit ibm.com/e-business/wimbledon/lob.html * * * * * * * * * * * * QUOTE OF THE DAY "When I broke him he started playing less and less and I got more confident. I think he wasn't playing how he was two days ago." Richard Krajicek on beating Paradorn Srichaphan, the Thai player who saw off Andre Agassi on Tuesday. * * * * * * * * * * * * * RESULTS Men's singles, round 2 Mark Philippoussis (Aus) beat Nicolas Kiefer (Ger) 3-6, 6-3, 6-4, 6-2 Richard Krajicek (Ned) beat Paradorn Srichaphan (Tha) 7-6(7-5), 6-4, 6-2 Wayne Arthurs (Aus) beat Taylor Dent (USA) 7-6(7-2), 7-6(7-3), 6-7(4-7), 7-6(7-5) (27) X Malisse (Bel) beat (5) Y Kafelnikov (Rus) 7-6(7-4), 7-5, 6-1 Women's singles, round 2 Chanda Rubin (USA) beat (21) Tatiana Panova (Rus) 6-4, 6-1 (7) Jelena Dokic (Yug) beat (25) Nathalie Dechy (Fra) 7-5, 6-2 (11) Daniela Hantuchova (Svk) beat Maja Matevzic (Slo) 6-4, 6-4 (3) Jennifer Capriati (USA) beat (26) Daja Bedanova (Cze) 6-4, 6-2 (2) Serena Williams (USA) beat Els Callens (Bel) 7-6(7-5), 7-6(7-2) Eleni Daniilidou (Gre) beat Miriam Oremans (Ned) 7-6(7-5), 6-4
